channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13258] LLAP: Add hdfs bytes read and spilled bytes to tez print summary
item.description: When printing counters to console it will be useful to print hdfs bytes read and spilled bytes which will help with debugging issues faster.
item.summary: LLAP: Add hdfs bytes read and spilled bytes to tez print summary

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: FileSystemCounters does not show up for LLAP. Siddharth Seth Do we need any tez side changes for these? Can we hold on to FileSystem reference somewhere and when we unregister the task read FS counters, update the TezCounters (that we add in registerTask()) and remove the references?

Initial patch and the sample output image showing fs counters on console.
I have also added post hook changes to print these counters that can be used for tests. But it will not work until we move to tez 0.8.3 version. After upgrading tez version we can change orc_llap.q to use the post hook for printing the counters. Siddharth Seth Can you please review this patch?
Adding image showing counters after 100% data and metadata cache hit.
I probably have to rebase this patch after HIVE-13433 is committed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12800260 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
Removing 2.1.0 target. Please feel free to commit to branch-2.1 anyway and fix for 2.1.0 if this happens before the release.
New patch addresses Siddharth Seth's code review comments. Also adds qfile based tests for printing counters.
Siddharth Seth Can you please take another look?
Also this patch needs tez-0.8.4-SNAPSHOT for compilation.
Left comments on RB - mostly minor.
Siddharth Seth Thanks for the review! Addressed your review comments. Can you please take another look?
Addressed Siddharth Seth's review comments. Also using 0.8.4-SNAPSHOT tez version for precommit test run.
Removed the map from thread pool per Siddharth Seth's comment.
